skill.name: architecture-decision-records
skill.description: Write and maintain Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) following best practices for technical decision documentation. Use when documenting significant technical decisions, reviewing past architectural choices, or establishing decision processes.
skill.summary: Write and maintain Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) following best practices for technical decis...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only templates and guidance for writing Architecture Decision Records. All 56 static findings are false positives: detected patterns are markdown documentation examples, harmless text strings in prose, and legitimate documentation links. No executable code, file access, network activity, or external commands are present.

content.value_statement: Teams lose context when decisions are undocumented or scattered. This skill provides ADR templates, lifecycle guidance, and review checklists to capture decisions consistently.
actual_capabilities: Provide a standard ADR template in MADR format with context and consequences
Provide a lightweight ADR template for quick decisions
Provide Y-Statement and deprecation ADR templates
Provide an RFC-style ADR template with detailed sections
Outline ADR directory structure and index guidance
List ADR review checklist and best practices
limitations: Does not generate project specific facts or metrics
Does not create files or automate repository changes
Does not validate feasibility or performance claims

use_cases.title: Document major choices
use_cases.description: Create structured ADRs for database, platform, and integration decisions.

use_cases.title: Standardize decision logs
use_cases.description: Adopt a consistent ADR process and review checklist across teams.

use_cases.title: Review past decisions
use_cases.description: Understand historical choices and their consequences during onboarding.

prompt_templates.title: Draft a simple ADR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a lightweight ADR for adopting TypeScript in our frontend. Include context, decision, and consequences.

prompt_templates.title: Compare options ADR
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a standard ADR comparing PostgreSQL, MySQL, and MongoDB for our product catalog.

prompt_templates.title: Supersede an ADR
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a deprecation ADR to replace MongoDB with PostgreSQL, including a migration plan.

prompt_templates.title: RFC style ADR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an RFC style ADR for event sourcing in order management, with motivation, design, drawbacks, and alternatives.

output_examples.input: Write an ADR to adopt Redis for caching product pages.
output: ADR-0010: Use Redis for product page caching
Context: Slow page loads during peak traffic
Decision: Add Redis as a read through cache
Consequences: Faster reads, added cache invalidation work

output_examples.input: Create an ADR for choosing between REST and GraphQL.
output: ADR-0015: Use GraphQL for the API layer
Context: Mobile clients need flexible data fetching
Decision: Adopt GraphQL with Apollo Server
Considered: REST API with pagination, Falcor

best_practices: Record both positive and negative consequences
Link related ADRs and update status over time
anti_patterns: Editing accepted ADRs instead of superseding them
Using vague language without clear decisions

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is plain text guidance and templates that work in any assistant.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It provides templates and checklists only, not automated file creation.

faq.question: Can it integrate with adr-tools or my repo?
faq.answer: It includes adr-tools commands but does not run them or edit files.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it contains static documentation with no data access behavior.

faq.question: What if the ADR feels too long?
faq.answer: Use the lightweight template and keep it to the essential context and decision.

faq.question: How is this different from a design doc?
faq.answer: It records a specific decision and rationale, not full implementation details.
